che16.dcs.aber.ac.uk.model

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • che16.dcs.aber.ac.uk.model.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class represents the necessary components of a Travelling Salesman Problem representation. This Class also maintains and manipulates the collection of ants and cities as well as Control the access to the pheromonne matrix.
    Author:
    Christopher Edwards

             int method)
        Constructor with specified parameter values
        Parameters:
        aco - the current AntColonyOptimisation instance
        numberOfAnts - the number of ants
        noOfCities - the number of cities
        numberOfUphill - the number of uphil paths to be generated
        method - the method used for this algorithms execution

        noOfCities - the number of cities
        tempCities - the collection of predefined City locations
        numberOfUphill - the number of uphill paths to be generated

        public void initDistanceMatrix()
        Initialise the distanceMatrix based upon the size of the cities collection. This distance metric used is the Euclidean distance.

        public void updatePheromone(int x,
                            int y,
                            double newPheromone)
        Update the pheromone for edge x,y given the specified value
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate for the edge
        y - the y coordinate for the edge
        newPheromone - the amount of pheromone to add to the edge

      • calculatePheromones

        public double calculatePheromones(double current,
                                  double newPheromone)
        Calculate the pheromone value given the specified value. This factors in the current pheromone levels and decayRate.
        Parameters:
        current - the current pheromone concentration
        newPheromone - the amount of new pheromone to add
        Returns:
        the update pheromone concentration after deposit and decay operations
